instruction: You are a helpful assistant tasked with analyzing the stances of tweet authors in tweets related to `fask masks`. Determine whether each tweet expresses a Favorable, Against, or Neutral stance.
input:
Identify the stance of tweet: `There are many selfish people. Some people don't wear their masks properly, not covering their nose and mouth. They put it under their chin while walking in malls or communities. Some vendors do it too, some only cover their mouths, leaving their noses exposed. 

Some people cough and sneeze, but why do they have to pull off their masks to do it and only put it back on afterward? Selfish, trying to protect themselves while spreading it to others. I've seen it many times.` on topic of `fask masks`
english_comment_text:
There are many selfish people. Some people don't wear their masks properly, not covering their nose and mouth. They put it under their chin while walking in malls or communities. Some vendors do it too, some only cover their mouths, leaving their noses exposed. 

Some people cough and sneeze, but why do they have to pull off their masks to do it and only put it back on afterward? Selfish, trying to protect themselves while spreading it to others. I've seen it many times.

The reason is that it reduces the spread of the virus even if it is a cloth mask that barely protects against the virus.` on topic of `fask masks`
english_comment_text: I think the virus is less likely to spread through the air than through touch. Wearing a mask is probably more about reducing the spread of germs from mucus and saliva than it is about preventing the virus from entering the body directly from the air (except in enclosed spaces). The reason is that it reduces the spread of the virus even if it is a cloth mask that barely protects against the virus.

Whoever wants to get vaccinated can get vaccinated; whoever doesn't want to, doesn't have to. Whoever wants to wear a mask can wear one; whoever doesn't want to doesn't have to. No one thinks we're clowns or forbids us from entering any place.  My child can go to school without having to be vaccinated or attend online classes.` on topic of `fask masks`
english_comment_text: My family and I have moved to Florida. Here, they don't force anything. Whoever wants to get vaccinated can get vaccinated; whoever doesn't want to, doesn't have to. Whoever wants to wear a mask can wear one; whoever doesn't want to doesn't have to. No one thinks we're clowns or forbids us from entering any place.  My child can go to school without having to be vaccinated or attend online classes.

This is what they mean by health being the most important. Even if you have money, you can't buy life right now.` on topic of `fask masks`
english_comment_text: At this rate, why hasn't anyone made a vaccine yet? I'd pay anything for it. If only there was a vaccine... I'm so tired of being afraid to do anything or go anywhere.  Hand sanitiser and masks are impossible to find even if you're willing to pay a fortune. Sigh... life.  This is what they mean by health being the most important. Even if you have money, you can't buy life right now.
